title: Nudibranch
summary: Nudibranchs (/ˈnjuːdɪbræŋk/[2]) are a group of soft-bodied, marine gastropod molluscs which shed their shells after their larval stage.[3] They are noted for their often extraordinary colours and striking forms, and they have been given colourful nicknames to match, such as "clown", "marigold", "splendid", "dancer", "dragon",[4] or "sea rabbit".[5] Currently, about 3,000 valid species of nudibranchs are known.[6]
